intro: Satureja taygetea, commonly known as Greek thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils that contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. Satureja taygetea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
